newsitem.title: USA: Midisoft unveils internet media software.
newsitem.headline: Midisoft unveils internet media software.

text.p: Internet software company Midisoft Corp on Tuesday unveiled an internet media product which will work with two of the leading versions of "streaming" media technology, the company said.

Midisoft's Internet Media Player allows users to listen to and view continuous, high-quality live audio and video and pre-recorded clips over the internet, via the user's browser. Midisoft's product will work with both Microsoft Corp's NetShow and privately held Progressive Networks Inc's RealMedia products, Midisoft said.

"Streaming" allows users to hear or see the clips with only a slight delay for buffering. Before such technology became widespread, users had to download files before they could be played back, making lengthy clips impractical.

Midisoft, in conjunction with Microsoft, is working to develop a number of NetShow-specific products for the Internet and corporate intranets, and Internet Media Player is the initial result from that collaboration, Midisoft said.
Midisoft's Internet Media Player can be purchased on CD or downloaded from the Midisoft web site for $24.95.
Shares of Midisoft rose 1-3/8 to 3-1/4 in active trade on Tuesday. ((Franklin Paul, New York Newsdesk, 212-859-1893))
